newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling ends week firm against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling ends week firm against dollar.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling was firm against the dollar on Friday, reversing a four-day losing streak on the back of dollar inflows from exporters and foreigner investors, commercial bank dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a mean commercial rate of 53.62 against the dollar from 53.67 on Thursday, while against the pound, the shilling was posted at a mean of 87.23 from 88.41.
Dealers said the shilling was holding steady against the dollar but added that it could strengthen further on some dollar inflows expected later in the day from coffee exporters.
Meanwhile the money market eased marginally. Overnight rates were quoted at between 12-16 percent from 17-18 percent on Thursday.
